isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - 9800 - SPICER 15-1/2 INCH (394 MM) SOLO™ CLUTCH - REMOVE

caution.para: Use a sling or transmission jack to support the transmission during removal. Never let the transmission hang unsupported in the splines of the driven discs. Following this precaution will prevent bending and distortion of the clutch driven discs.

step1.para: Disconnect the driveline from the transmission output shaft.

note.para: Before proceeding with transmission removal, if the clutch is to be re-installed, depress the clutch pedal and slide the wear indicating tab to the new position ( Figure 2). It may be necessary to lightly tap it, being careful not to break the tab. Release the clutch pedal.

figure.caption: Figure 2. Slide Wear Indicating Tab to New Position

step1.para: Disconnect the external clutch linkage from the transmission cross shaft lever.
Remove the transmission clutch housing to flywheel housing bolts.
Rotate the cross shaft lever to allow the release yoke fingers to clear the release bearing housing.
Carefully slide the transmission rearward and out.

caution.para: Support transmission weight during removal to prevent damage to the driven discs and release bearing.
